definition[0]: to give something such as a car to the person you are buying a new one from, as part of the payment
example[0]: He traded his old car in for a new model.
definition[1]: a used car, piece of equipment etc that you give to a seller of a new one that you are buying as part of the payment
example[1]: Are you going to give your Ford as a trade-in?
definition[2]: to give something, such as a car, as part of the payment for something you are buying
example[3]: The Toyota dealer only offered him $4,000 to trade it in.
definition[3]: a way of buying a new car, computer etc in which you give the seller your old car etc as part of the payment
example[4]: A dealer may accept old equipment as a trade-in on a new computer.
example[5]: They can’t afford a new car because thetrade-in value of the old one has dropped so much.
